ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to conduct statistical analysis on datasets. This course reinforced many concepts that were covered in my stats class, so I feel that I have a better grasp on the material.
I learned how psychology/psychiatry research is done and analyzed, as well as how to evaluate papers on the topic of psychosis

Methods of research on psychopathology, specifically psychosis. Also knowledge of the etiology, risk factors, treatment, and social stigma of psychosis. We also went over stats techniques (logistic regression, linear regression, etc) and how to apply them. It was interesting.
Intro level statistical analysis techniques applied in the context of studying psychotic disorders, developing research questions, running analyses on real data sets, writing a scientific paper.
I learned so much about research methods, data analysis, and the newest debates and discoveries in the field of psychosis.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Professor Cannon is great. He opened each class with a lecture and then we had a discussion about the empirical papers assigned that week. When we had to do our final projects, he was very helpful. The labs that we did for class were great models for how to conduct analyses for the final paper. I only have positive things to say about this course.

Strengths- interesting, classes helped to prepare for labs, labs and class discussions helped to prepare for final projects

Weakness- it would have been nice to get feedback/grades on labs before the final data analysis and/or report was due

Assignments are all pretty helpful and not too stressful. Interesting subject material. I felt the skills I learned were valuable and I can already feel them helping in my other classes. One point of improvement in my opinion is that in-class discussions sometimes fell flat due to the on-rails format - being asked / answering questions based on our discussion question responses. The timeliness of feedback could also maybe be improved - lab assignments were not graded until after finals period, and it could have been nice to have feedback on those for the final paper.
This course made learning feel easy by giving us time to discuss our ideas with each other and build off our ideas.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! The content was so interesting and important. Professor Cannon is so established in the field, and it was so cool to learn from an expert who has written so many influential papers.
I would recommend it to someone with an interest in psychology or neuroscience research, even if they don't plan to research psychosis specifically

Yes! If you are interested in learning about the etiology and treatment of psychosis, research methods, and stats for psychopathology research. I found it very interesting and not very stressful or difficult.
Yes, a great way to fulfill research class req of the major.
Yes! If you're not interested in the subject matter I could imagine it being a little dry, but otherwise I think it's useful, not too difficult or stressful, and I personally really enjoy the topic.
Absolutely!!!  Dr. Cannon is amazing and the course is fun and engaging.
